intro: Nototriche ulophylla, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Nototriche ulophylla thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
